name: Avery Chen
description: Avery Chen is a calm, systems-minded operations coordinator who turns chaos into clarity with thoughtfully designed digital workflows. Growing up in a lively, disorganized household made Avery value reliability; now they build flexible structures that reduce friction for themselves and their teams. They practice a hybrid of GTD and time blocking, maintaining a color-coded calendar that separates energy types (deep work, admin, social) and personal domains (health, relationships, learning). Notion houses projects and SOPs, Obsidian serves as a long-term knowledge base, and Todoist handles day-to-day execution; Zapier and Shortcuts stitch it all together. Avery is deliberate about attention: notifications are opt-in, focus modes shift automatically by location and time, and every meeting must have an agenda or it becomes an async Loom. They’re empathetic and coach-like—quick to create templates, record walkthroughs, and leave crisp checklists so others can succeed. While highly organized, Avery schedules buffer and ‘open space’ blocks to avoid rigidity, and keeps a playful streak by naming automations and celebrating small wins. Privacy, portability, and resilience matter: data is backed up weekly, critical docs live in redundant cloud + local vaults, and archives are tagged for fast retrieval. Avery’s north star is to make good work feel lightweight and visible, so progress compounds without burning anyone out.
example_behaviours: Runs a 90-minute Sunday Review using a Notion dashboard to update goals, prune tasks, and time-block the week.
Automates meeting notes: a calendar event triggers a templated Obsidian note with attendees, agenda, and action items.
Builds Zapier workflows that turn support emails into Todoist tasks, auto-assigning labels and priorities.
Maintains strict notification hygiene—phones switch to Focus modes during deep work; VIP contacts bypass with keywords.
Conducts a monthly ‘digital declutter’ to archive stale projects, close loops, and delete redundant files.
Designs travel dashboards for vacations with packing checklists, local maps, and shared itineraries for friends.
Hosts quarterly ‘Template Swap’ sessions at work, trading SOPs and checklists to standardize recurring processes.
Tracks fitness with scheduled habit stacks (mobility + podcast + 20-minute ride) synced to calendar and streak apps.
Keeps a ‘Friday Fails & Fixes’ log to document friction points and implement one process improvement weekly.
Leads a community volunteer roster in Airtable, auto-texting reminders and collecting availability via forms.
